page.title: 05BARNSLEY CHURCH CONTINUED
page.content:
Elizabeth,the older,died on Jan 18th and her brother died on Jan 10th. Each one was buried the day after their death. There is a memorial to their mother, Elizabeth, who died the following year aged 22. Her husband's name is Brereton Bourchier Esquire and on his wife's Latin memorial he is called an 'armiger'. The name is also seen on a tablet to Sarah Bowchier, daughter of Robert Brereton of Cirencester, who died in 1762 aged 93.
Another local family, which used to own Barnsley Park, is the Wykeham-Musgraves. There is an enclosure in the churchyard, which is full of their graves, dating from 1770 to 1980. They also owned Thame Park in Oxfordshire. Mr. Wykeham-Musgrave still lives in the village.
